hourly.summary: Fans are buzzing with cautious optimism: transfer talk dominates (Rogers, Rodrygo, Tonali links), treble whispers linger, and women's Champions Cup glory lifts spirits. But concerns over player form ('dogshit' performances) and deadline day frustrations keep vibes realistically hopeful rather than euphoric. Classic Arsenal rollercoaster stuff – 'It’s the hope that kills you' but also 'Don’t stop believing!'

daily.summary: Arsenal fan sentiment fluctuated throughout the day, starting with cautious optimism after a win over Leeds, peaking with title buzz post-Man City/Spurs draw, but tempered by midday frustrations around player form and tactical debates. The period closed on a strong hopeful note (9/10) as rival results revitalized title hopes, though undercut by classic Arsenal superstition and injury concerns.

weekly.summary: Arsenal fan sentiment began the week deeply frustrated but showed a clear upward trend, peaking with euphoria after a decisive victory and sustained by rival stumbles that boosted title hopes. While recurring concerns about injuries, squad depth, and tactical debates tempered overall optimism, the dominant trajectory leaned hopeful with resilient fan camaraderie offsetting nervous energy.
